meanings.definition: The act of enclosing something in a capsule or covering.
meanings.sent1: The encapsulations of the vitamins ensured they stayed fresh.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the encapsulations of the medicine for her research.
meanings.sent3: The tiny encapsulations of flavor burst in his mouth like little surprises.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like encapsulations of wisdom, each one holding a valuable lesson.
meanings.sent5: The encapsulations of memories in her mind were like precious treasures to be cherished.

meanings.definition: The process of encapsulating or being encapsulated.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the encapsulations of data transfer is crucial in computer science.
meanings.sent2: The encapsulations of the seeds in the soil led to successful germination.
meanings.sent3: The encapsulations of thoughts in his mind seemed to dance around playfully.
meanings.sent4: The encapsulations of time in photographs freeze moments for eternity.
meanings.sent5: The encapsulations of emotions in her songs touched the hearts of many listeners.

meanings.sent1: The encapsulations on the pills made them easier to swallow.
meanings.sent2: The encapsulations on the wires prevented them from getting tangled.
meanings.sent3: The encapsulations on the phone case kept it safe from scratches.
meanings.sent4: The encapsulations of paint on the walls added a glossy finish to the room.
meanings.sent5: The encapsulations of warmth in the blanket kept her cozy on cold nights.
